greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array T read by diagonals; T(i,j) = number of lines passing through (i,j) and at least two other lattice points (h,k) satisfying 0<=h<=i, 0<=k<=j.
comment: It appears that A049639(n, k) = A049687(n/2, k/2).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
mathematica: a[0|1, 0|1] = 0; a[0|1, _] = a[_, 0|1] = 1; a[i_, j_] := Module[{slopes, cnt}, slopes = Union @ Flatten @ Table[(k-j)/(h-i), {h, 0, i-1}, {k, 0, j - 1}]; cnt[slope_] := Count[Flatten[Table[{h, k}, {h, 0, i-1}, {k, 0, j - 1}], 1], {h_, k_} /; (k-j)/(h-i) == slope]; Count[cnt /@ slopes, c_ /; c >= 2] + 2]; Table[a[i-j, j], {i, 0, 12}, {j, 0, i}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 03 2017 *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
